meta.name: SMS Messaging API Integration for AI Agents with BulkSMS

name: BulkSMS JSON REST API MCP Server

parameters.content:
### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Configure Authentication**: 
Set up basic credentials

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### üí° Usage Notes
‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 15 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### üõ†Ô∏è Customization
‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## üõ†Ô∏è BulkSMS JSON REST MCP Server ‚úÖ 15 operations

### About
The BulkSMS JSON REST API (base URL: `https://api.bulksms.com/v1`) enables sending and receiving SMS messages, accessing message history, and viewing account details. All requests require `Content-Type: application/json` and support features like Unicode encoding, group messaging, and batch sends. Dates must be ISO-8601 formatted, and unknown response properties should be ignored for forward compatibility.

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the BulkSMS JSON REST API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://api.bulksms.com/v1
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### üìã Available Operations (15 endpoints)

**Blocked Numbers (2 operations)**
List Blocked Numbers, Block Phone Number

**Credits (1 operations)**
Transfer Account Credits

**Message (5 operations)**
Retrieve Message History, Send New Message, Send Quick Message, View Message Details, List Related Messages

**Profile (1 operations)**
Retrieve User Profile

**Attachments (1 operations)**
Generate Attachment Upload URL

**Web Hooks (5 operations)**
List All Webhooks, Register New Webhook, Remove Webhook, Get Webhook Details, Update Webhook Settings

parameters.name: min-id
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('min-id', 'Records with an `id` that is greater or equal to min-id will be returned. The default value is `0`. You can add 1 to an id that you previously retrieved, to return subsequent records.', 'number') }}

parameters.name: limit
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('limit', 'The maximum number of records to return. The default value is `10000`. The value cannot be greater than 10000.', 'number') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List blocked numbers

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ min-id (optional) - Records with an `id` that is greater or equal to min-id will be returned. The default value is `0`. You can add 1 to an id that you previously retrieved, to return subsequent records.
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Maximum number of records to return. The default value is `10000`. The value cannot be greater than 10000.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('limit', 'The maximum number of messages that are returned. The default is 1000. The value of `limit` is not a guarantee that a specific number of messages will be in the response, even if there are more messages available. Consider the case where you have 150 messages and you specify `limit=50`. It is possible that only 49 messages will be returned. The way to make sure that there are no more messages is to submit a new call using the `id` filter field with the `<` operator (described below).', 'number') }}

parameters.name: filter
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('filter', 'See the message filtering for more information.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sortOrder', 'The default value is DESCENDING If the `sortOrder` is DESCENDING, the newest messages be first in the result. ASCENDING places the oldest messages on top of the response.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Retrieve Messages

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Maximum number of messages that are returned. The default is 1000. The value of `limit` is not a guarantee that a specific number of messages will be in the response, even if there are more messages available. Consider the case where you have 150 messages and you specify `limit=50`. It is possible that only 49 messages will be returned. The way to make sure that there are no more messages is to submit a new call using the `id` filter field with the `<` operator (described below).
  ‚Ä¢ filter (optional) - See the message filtering for more information.
  ‚Ä¢ sortOrder (optional) - Default value is DESCENDING If the `sortOrder` is DESCENDING, the newest messages be first in the result. ASCENDING places the oldest messages on top of the response.

parameters.name: deduplication-id
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('deduplication-id', 'Safeguards against the possibility of sending the same messages more than once. If a communication failure occurs during a submission, you cannot be sure that the submission was processed; therefore you would have to submit it again. When you post the retry, you must use the `deduplication-id` of the original post. The BulkSMS system uses this ID to check that the request was not previously processed. (If it was previously processed, the submission will succeed, and the behaviour will be indistinguishable to you from a non-duplicated submission). The ID expires after about 12 hours.', 'number') }}

parameters.name: auto-unicode
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('auto-unicode', 'Specifies how to deal with message text that contains characters not present in the GSM 03.38 character set. Messages that contain only GSM 03.38 characters are not affected by this setting. If the value is `true` then a message containing non-GSM 03.38 characters will be transmitted as a Unicode SMS (which is most likely more costly). Please note: when `auto-unicode` is `true` and the value of the `encoding` property is specified as `UNICODE`, the message will always be sent as `UNICODE`. If the value is `false` and the `encoding` property is `TEXT` then non-GSM 03.38 characters will be replaced by the `?` character. When using this setting on the API, you should take case to ensure that your message is _clean_. Invisible unicode and unexpected characters could unintentionally convert an message to `UNICODE`. A common mistake is to use the backtick character (\`) which is unicode and will turn your `TEXT` message into a `UNICODE` message.', 'boolean', false) }}

parameters.name: schedule-date
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('schedule-date', 'Allows you to send a message in the future. An example value is `2019-02-18T13:00:00+02:00`. It encodes to `2019-02-18T13%3A00%3A00%2B02%3A00`. Credits are deducted from your account immediately. Once submitted, scheduled messages cannot be changed or cancelled. The date can be a maximum of two years in the future. If the value is in the past, the message will be sent immediately. The date format requires you to supply an offset from UTC. You can decide to use the offset of your timezone, or maybe the zone of the recipient's location is more appropriate. If the destination is a group, the group members are determined at the time that you submit the message; not the time the message is scheduled to be sent.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: schedule-description
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('schedule-description', 'A note that is stored together with a scheduled submission, which could be used to more easily identify the scheduled submission at a later date. The value of this field is ignored if the `schedule-date` is not provided. A value that is longer than 256 characters is truncated.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Send Messages

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ deduplication-id (optional) - Safeguards against the possibility of sending the same messages more than once. If a communication failure occurs during a submission, you cannot be sure that the submission was processed; therefore you would have to submit it again. When you post the retry, you must use the `deduplication-id` of the original post. The BulkSMS system uses this ID to check that the request was not previously processed. (If it was previously processed, the submission will succeed, and the behaviour will be indistinguishable to you from a non-duplicated submission). The ID expires after about 12 hours.
  ‚Ä¢ auto-unicode (optional) - Specifies how to deal with message text that contains characters not present in the GSM 03.38 character set. Messages that contain only GSM 03.38 characters are not affected by this setting. If the value is `true` then a message containing non-GSM 03.38 characters will be transmitted as a Unicode SMS (which is most likely more costly). Please note: when `auto-unicode` is `true` and the value of the `encoding` property is specified as `UNICODE`, the message will always be sent as `UNICODE`. If the value is `false` and the `encoding` property is `TEXT` then non-GSM 03.38 characters will be replaced by the `?` character. When using this setting on the API, you should take case to ensure that your message is _clean_. Invisible unicode and unexpected characters could unintentionally convert an message to `UNICODE`. A common mistake is to use the backtick character (\`) which is unicode and will turn your `TEXT` message into a `UNICODE` message.
  ‚Ä¢ schedule-date (optional) - Allows you to send a message in the future. An example value is `2019-02-18T13:00:00+02:00`. It encodes to `2019-02-18T13%3A00%3A00%2B02%3A00`. Credits are deducted from your account immediately. Once submitted, scheduled messages cannot be changed or cancelled. The date can be a maximum of two years in the future. If the value is in the past, the message will be sent immediately. The date format requires you to supply an offset from UTC. You can decide to use the offset of your timezone, or maybe the zone of the recipient's location is more appropriate. If the destination is a group, the group members are determined at the time that you submit the message; not the time the message is scheduled to be sent.
  ‚Ä¢ schedule-description (optional) - A note that is stored together with a scheduled submission, which could be used to more easily identify the scheduled submission at a later date. The value of this field is ignored if the `schedule-date` is not provided. A value that is longer than 256 characters is truncated.

Send message by simple GET or POST

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ to (required) - Phone number of the recipient.
  ‚Ä¢ body (required) - Text you want to send.
  ‚Ä¢ deduplication-id (optional) - Refer to the `deduplication-id` parameter.

parameters.url: =https://api.bulksms.com/v1/messages/{{ $fromAI('id', 'The `id` of the message you want to retrieve', 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription:
Show Message

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required) - `id` of the message you want to retrieve

List Related Messages

- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required) - `id` of the sent message
Upload an attachment via a signed URL

Delete a webhook

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required) - `id` of the webhook

Read a webhook

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required) - `id` of the webhook

Update a webhook

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ id (required) - `id` of the webhook
